intro: Griselinia lucida, commonly known as the shining glory bush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aquifoliales order and belongs to the family Cornaceae, which includes the dogwoods. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that appear in spring. Its leaves are glossy and elliptical, providing ornamental value in gardens. Griselinia lucida is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
